sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个动词均有"营救，拯救，搭救"之意。
means: rescue ： 多指营救某人脱离紧迫的危险。
save ： 含义广泛，既可指营救某人使脱离危险，也可指精神或道德上的拯救。

sentence.Network_en: Paramilitary police units are taking part in rescue efforts.
sentence.Network_cn: 准军事警察部队正在参与营救行动。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French rescoure from Latin re- (expressing intensive force) + excutere 'shake out, discard'

entry.def: If you rescue someone, you get them out of a dangerous or unpleasant situation.

example.ex: Helicopters rescued nearly 20 people from the roof of the burning building...
example.tran: 直升机从失火大楼的楼顶救出了将近20人。

example.ex: He had rescued her from a horrible life.
example.tran: 他把她从可怕的生活中解救了出来。

entry.def: Rescue is help which gets someone out of a dangerous or unpleasant situation.

example.ex: Lights clipped onto life jackets improve the chances of rescue...
example.tran: 别在救生衣上的灯提高了获救可能性。

example.ex: A big rescue operation has been launched for a trawler missing in the English Channel.
example.tran: 为寻找在英吉利海峡失踪的一艘拖网渔船，人们展开了一场大规模的搜救行动。

entry.tran: 营救行动;救援行动;救助行为
entry.def: A rescue is an attempt to save someone from a dangerous or unpleasant situation.

example.ex: A major air-sea rescue is under way...
example.tran: 一场大规模的海空营救行动正在进行。

example.ex: Five children were pulled from the smoke-filled house in heroic rescues by fire crews.
example.tran: 在消防人员英勇的营救行动中，有5个孩子从浓烟弥漫的房子里被救出。

entry.def: If you go to someone's rescue or come to their rescue, you help them when they are in danger or difficulty.

example.ex: The 23-year-old's screams alerted a passerby who went to her rescue...
example.tran: 那个23岁女孩的尖叫引来了一位过路人前去营救。

example.ex: The crisis puts strong political pressure on the state government to come to the rescue.
example.tran: 这次危机给前来救助的州政府带来了巨大的政治压力。

means.word_mean: 1. recovery or preservation from loss or danger;

sentences.sentence: "a surgeon's job is the saving of lives"

abbreviation.mean_en: remote emergency salvage and cleanup equipment
abbreviation.mean_cn: 远程紧急救援和清除设备

Sentence.sentence: One of the greatest heartbreaks for fire fighters occurs when they fail to rescue a child from a burning building because the child, frightened by smoke and noise, hides under a bed or in a closet and is later found dead.

For example, several months after listening to an informative speech, Pete Gentry in North Carolina rescued his brother who is choking on food, by using the method taught by student speaker, Julie Paris.
He rescued a student from a big fire
Left alone, it was assumed, the world's rain forests would not only flourish but might even rescue us from disaster by absorbing the excess carbon dioxide and other planet-warming greenhouse gases.
Internet rescue camps in South Korea and China try to save kids addicted to the screen.
Rescue workers were at the scene.

sentences.en: They are performing an attempt of a rescue.
sentences.cn: 他们正在进行营救行动。

means.word_mean: 营救, 救援; 使免遭损失

sentences.en: The government has rescued the firm from bankruptcy by giving them a grant.
sentences.cn: 政府通过给企业拨款使他们免遭倒闭。

jushi.english: They rescued the boy from danger.
She was rescued from a burning building.
jushi.chinese: 她被人从着火的大楼里救了出来。
